alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 11:27AM EST until February 16 at 9:24PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Richland and Lexington Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Sunday the stage was 112.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 119.6 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.
